content: the sock is worked in plain stockinette charted and written instructions are page 4 and 5 2 mint tea socks by debbie ford heel flap row below and k tbl pick up and k 14 16 18 sts along your heel flap if you are using a contrast colour for the heel start knitting your heel in contrast yarn now round 1 k to 2 sts before marker k2tog do not break your main coloured yarn work next row in right/left mint tea pattern across the front of sock sm ssk k to end of turn your work so the ws is facing you you round are now going to be working back and forth on the next 28 32 36 sts the remaining 28 round 2 k to m sm work next row in 32 36 sts are the front of the sock and will right/left mint tea pattern across the front of be left unworked for now sock sm k to end of round row 1 ws sl1 p 27 31 35 repeat rounds 1 and 2 until you have decreased down to your original stitch count row 2 rs sl1 k1 repeat across 28 32 36 with 28 32 36 sts on the back of your sock sts k to m sm this is now your bor and you can repeat row 1 and 2 13 15 17 more times remove the other st markers as you work the 14 16 18 in total next round then work row 1 once more foot heel turn continue working in established pattern until row 1 rs sl1 k 16 18 20 ssk k1 turn the foot measures 5 cm / 2 inches less than desired foot length i recommend ending row 2 ws sl1 p7 p2tog p1 turn having worked row 10 of the right/left mint tea pattern row 3 rs sl1 k to 1 st before your last turn ssk using 1 st from each side of the gap k1 if using contrast yarn for the toes break yarn turn here and start working with
